citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
This inspection was conducted at the Hibbing Memorial Arena in Hibbing, MN. The inspector watched a performance of
the Circus Spectacular.
A written itinerary was not submitted by the licensee prior to exhibition with overnight travel. The licensee was in travel
status at the time of inspection, and no itinerary was available or submitted for overnight travel.
Failure to provide and update itinerary information results in the Department's inability to conduct an inspection to ensure
the welfare of the animals covered under the Animal Welfare Act.
The licensee must submit a written itinerary to the Deputy Administrator no sooner than 48 hours in advance of any travel
when exhibiting any animal overnight at any location other than the approved home site. The itinerary shall include all
information required in this section, but not limited to, the names, dates, and locations (with addresses) where the animals
will travel, be housed, and be exhibited, including all anticipated dates and locations (with addresses) for any stops and
layovers that allow or require removal of the animals from the transport enclosures.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.126(c)  Repeat
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
This inspection was conducted at the Hibbing Memorial Arena in Hibbing, MN. The inspector watched a performance of 
the Circus Spectacular.  
 
A written itinerary was not submitted by the licensee prior to exhibition with overnight travel. The licensee was in travel 
status at the time of inspection, and no itinerary was available or submitted for overnight travel.  
 
Failure to provide and update itinerary information results in the Department's inability to conduct an inspection to ensure 
the welfare of the animals covered under the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
The licensee must submit a written itinerary to the Deputy Administrator no sooner than 48 hours in advance of any travel 
when exhibiting any animal overnight at any location other than the approved home site. The itinerary shall include all 
information required in this section, but not limited to, the names, dates, and locations (with addresses) where the animals 
will travel, be housed, and be exhibited, including all anticipated dates and locations (with addresses) for any stops and 
layovers that allow or require removal of the animals from the transport enclosures. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
